reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on business. Overall, this hotel is a little nicer than most Mariott's and Hilton's. The lobby area is very nice, well decorated and has a very rich feeling. The staff is very good but the staff at the registration desk is remarkably SLOW, I mean Bahama's SLOW. On two different occasions, I went to the front desk for something simple and both times, the staff spent at least 10 minutes explaining every detail to the guest ahead of me. Everything from "How was your parking experience, Let me tell you about all our restaurants, here is how you get to the salon, the pool hours are !!! By the time they got finished there were 10 paeople in line....
reviews.title: Pretty nice, needs some upgrades

reviews.text: As for the rooms, they were average size and pretty nice, but the beds were small. My room had two "queen" size beds but they looked like kid size twin beds. The restroom was above average and was roomy and nicely decorated. The noteable item in the room was a cheap 19" K-Mart color TV with minimal channels. Kind of like putting a KIA in a Mercedes showroom.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place

reviews.text: Attended wedding on Long Island. Hotel is a very fancy place; comfortable, clean, upscale, and I did not find it tired or outdated. Rate negotiated by wedding hosts was very reasonable ($209/nite). Rehersal dinner at hotel was excellent. Elective meal opportunities in hotel were expensive. Several Deli's and a cardshop breakfast place about two blocks east were excellent for such meals. Very nice stay.
reviews.title: Garden City Hotel Oh My

likes.disliked: — The noise from nearby train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved two rooms for a Sunday night stay following a 5:00 wedding at the hotel. Since check-in time is 3:00, we called the hotel on Saturday to request an early check-in. We were told that this could not be guaranteed but would be noted in the reservation. When we arrived at 2:00 on Sunday, one room was ready and we were told they would put a "rush" on the second room, which would be ready in a few minutes. We left our luggage on a trolley with the bellman and went to the nearby town for a quick lunch. When we returned at 3:10, the second room was still not ready (and our bags remained on display in the middle of the lobby). The desk clerk said he was able to locate another room on the same floor as the first room that was ready. This was not adjacent to our first room--it was down the hall, which was acceptable to us. We requested, however, that it not be an "adjoining" room and were assured that it was not. (This process took approximately 20 minutes as the room had been blocked for another arriving guest and had to be unblocked by the manager). When we finally arrived in the room, it turned out to be an adjoining room after all. When we complained, the manager said to hold on for 2 or 3 minutes while he located a non-adjoining room. At 3:45 (approximately 10 minutes later), the manager called back to say it would be another 15 minutes before a non-adjoining room would become available. Since only an hour remained before the wedding was to begin and we still needed to get dressed, we told him we would keep the assigned room. It would have been very easy for the hotel to have blocked 2 adjoining rooms when we made the reservation (or when we called the day before to request early check-in), but this was obviously too difficult for them. The room was a good size but the carpet was stained and torn in places and the bathtub had not been renovated . The bed was much too soft and the linens were unpressed, Holiday Inn-quality--obviously not the upgraded type of bedding that all the better chain hotels are now providing. When we were about to leave our room for the wedding, we discovered that the room safe did not work. We were able to use the safe in our second room instead. No one seemed to care or take note of this when we mentioned it at checkout. All in all, this was a very disappointing experience. The hotel staff could use a few lessons in professional management style. We would not stay here again. The one positive note was that we thought the catering staff did a very nice job with the wedding.
reviews.title: Not the Ritz

reviews.text: I recently spent 6 nights here. I had a wonderful experience. First, everyone on the staff is amazing: friendly, helpful, and super professional. So unusual these days. To me, always an indication that management treats them well.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room, the least expensive, was nicely furnished, immaculate, and quiet. I don't quite understand the complaints of others. Maybe I had an updated room (ask for one). Be aware that the building is 30 years old, so if you want everything to look brand new, stay somewhere else. That having been said, I found the public spaces in top condition and immaculate. The glitzy Ceasar's Palace - Fall of Pompeii- style interior decoration of the public spaces wasn't to my liking, and seemed outdated, but it was well done, for what it was. (Gave me a chuckle.) The interior decoration of the rooms is not glitzy, thank goodness.
reviews.title: Nice on the outside.... Not so much on the inside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the best part of Garden City, with lovely neighborhoods surrounding it, and a very pleasant village of shops and restaurants a block away.

reviews.text: The heater was another problem. The settings are either on or off basically and the room would get ridiculously uncomfortable and dry or too cold. You were unable to adjust based on temperature and simply had to use a "dial" system.
reviews.title: Rooms are Tired - definitely NOT the best of Long Island
Lovely Respite at The Garden City Hotel
reviews.text: The Garden City Hotel is a member of the "Preferred Hotels & Resorts" group. I was travelling with my 90 year old mother. We chose it for its location near LaGuardia and JFK (about mid-point between the two) for a one night "stay-over" to rest up for the rest of our trip across country.

What stands out the most about the Hotel is the service and attitude of the staff and the Hotel's location in easy and lovely walking distance to a quaint street of restaurants and shops. We booked a Superior Double/handicapped room that was very comfortable and roomy.
reviews.title: Very Nice...more seems to be coming

likes.liked: — Service, Restaurants, Location (town and proximity to LIRR to NYC)

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: Room Service at night and in the morning was unusually prompt and thorough with a lovely presentation. The food was very good and generous portions were served.
The Bellman, Luis, was so very kind to me and my very elderly mother that if I could, I would remember him in my Will. All the staff were friendly and provided personalized service.
reviews.title: Awsome staff
Great Lobby but it stops there!
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed walking out around the Hotel into the adjacent tree-line neighborhood with lovely old Victorian homes and then taking in dinner and lunch "al fresco" on the 7th street area of shops and cafes. I would return in a heartbeat.
